function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inertial pressures to conform to laws, regulations, and decrees imposed by local and state governments.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Deliberate communication strategies using accommodative signals are necessary, even if costly.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Firms resisting the use of accommodative signals in communication","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Social construction of hurricanes as acts of nature may limit proactive disease mitigation efforts","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Information asymmetry in pandemic situations can hinder effective communication and response","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Surplus information held by some entities during a pandemic may not be effectively shared with others","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Different frames of reference for the cause of the pandemic leading to differential influences on beliefs and attitudes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Socially constructed contagion frames of reference leading to different meanings and behaviors","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective response to natural disasters due to lack of resilience","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Racial stereotypes perpetuated by covid medical studies influencing brand decisions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risks of mishandling past depictions of slavery in media and entertainment.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Theorizing and human connectedness in pandemic research impacting societal trust and organizational resilience.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Covid-19 transmission through close contact","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Theorizing and rebranding without successful implementation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid turnover of untested ideas leading to fads","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious disease transmission in dense urban areas due to increased customer footfall in pickup locations","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of contagion in restaurants due to high customer turnover and close proximity","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential contamination and transmission of diseases through food delivery and pickup services","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conflicting and minute guidelines from governments and chain owners creating challenges for food restaurant franchisees in implementing covid-19 reopening protocols.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Adoption of creative tinkering by firms in various industries due to the constraining nature of regulations.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Proactive adoption of drive-in screening options by cinema theatres in response to covid-19 regulatory constraints.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of adherence to social distancing regulations in institutional environments","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Provision of free masks by hair salons without adherence to health and safety regulations","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Theorizing and significant investment in brand meaning without clear economic justification","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conformity to rules and norms may stifle innovation and growth.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Deviation from the norm and isomorphism may lead to a lack of adaptation to disruptions like pandemics.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of adoption of modern institutional theory may hinder firms from achieving social legitimacy and innovation in dealing with disruptions like pandemics.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation due to crowded indoor environments such as casinos","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Normative pressure leading to potential neglect of health and safety regulations","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mimicking of social norms leading to potential disregard for health and safety measures","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Disease transmission in the built environment due to social interactions and legitimacy-seeking activities","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Studies under the functionalist school focused on rational efforts of managers to maximize efficiency through the coordination and control of work activities.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift toward studying contingency variables such as environmental uncertainty, and determining their effect on structure.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Bounded rationality studies suggesting that managers are boundedly rational, and decision making entails a satisficing rather than an optimizing approach.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Power dependence theory and institutional theory providing a supplemental and different viewpoint for conceptualizing organizations.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Integration of institutional theory with past pandemics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 on service firms and customer interaction","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Resistance to adopting new practices such as e-consulting for haircuts","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty achieving theorization in all service sectors","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited ability for service firms to affect customer demand during a pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate adaptation to covid-19 disruptions in the service industry","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of social legitimacy and acceptance of adaptive strategies","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffective measures to control virus transmission in service environments","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Close physical interaction in service industries increases the risk of contagious diseases propagation.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adherence to new regulations wearing masks in public leading to increased spread of the disease.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Severe loss of demand and revenues in non-essential services such as entertainment and tourism.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited access to financial aid and resources for smes, especially in skill development and training.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffective economic interventions","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffective public health policies","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Restructuring the team based on medical project requirements","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"}]}
